segments.text: Hello there , welcome to Wine World . Let me know if I can help you out at all .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Um , yes , please , I could really use some help . I'm going over to my boss'house for dinner tonight and don't know what kind of wine I should bring .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK , do you know what kind of food will be served ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , his wife is Japanese . He said she makes really good sushi .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Hmm , that's a bit of a challenge . Sushi is notoriously difficult to pair with wine . Well , let's see . have to be a white wine , of course .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why ? Wouldn't a red wine go well with sushi ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , I don't think so . Sushi is a very delicately flavored food , and red wine would be a jarring contrast . You need a white wine , which has more subtle flavors , to complement the fish .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I see . So should I get a bottle of Chardonnay ? That's a white wine , right ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , Chardonnay is a white wine , but I'm not sure it'd be your best bet . Chardonnay is one of the more fullbodied whites , and tends to be a bit oaky . I'd suggest that you go for something brighter , like this Sauvignon Blanc from New Zealand .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's another varietal , or type of grape , just like Chardonnay .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Let's see . The label says it's got " attractive citrus and grassy aromas that give way to crisp , mineral flavors and a bonedry finish . Serve chilled . " Oh , no , how long will it take to chill the wine ? I'm on my way to the dinner now .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's OK , don't worry , we'll just choose a wine from the cooler . We don't have quite as extensive a selection over here , but ... this Rhone Valley white would be lovely .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: All right . What varietal is that ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , this is a French wine , so they don't always specify the varietal on the label . The French believe that the soil a grape is grown in is one of the most important factors in the final flavor of the wine . This wine is probably a blend of a few different types of grapes , mostly Viognier , I'd guess .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: And you think this is a good wine ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , this is one of our best-sellers . It's not quite as dry as the Sauvignon Blanc we were looking at earlier , which means it's more approachable . It's light and crisp , with a bit of a vanilla aroma .
segments.speaker: S1
